item.title: Report E-2023080858
item.description:
Report E-2023080858

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: KING OF PRUSSIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XPH experienced a UN2735 Chemcure 289 release from a 55-gallon steel drum due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released to a 3’ x 3’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture XPO terminal personnel containerized the damaged drum into an 85-gallon poly overpack prior to the contractors arrival. The contractors deployed absorbents and cleaned the impacted area. All cleanup debris was then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080855
item.description:
Report E-2023080855

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: GLEN MILLS
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWC experienced a UN1993 Resolv EC2472A release from a 330-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-tablespoon of product released to the tote body due to the tote cap not being sealed correctly. The crew re-secured the tote and preformed a slosh test to ensure no further release would occur in transit. The tote was wiped down and all impacted rags were placed into a 5-gallon metal pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023080789
item.description:
Report X-2023080789

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: BRIDGEPORT
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080789 SequenceEvent: Hazmat skid toppled on pickup trailer crushing boxes and causing leak from inner bottles. DescribePack: Leaking from threaded closure DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leak contained to outer packaging, boxes removed from trailer for processing. 2. X-2023080806 SequenceEvent: Hazmat skid overturned on pickup vehicle crushing boxes and causing inner bottles to leak. DescribePack: Threaded caps damaged DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged packages removed from vehicle. 3. X-2023080807 SequenceEvent: Hazmat skid toppled on pickup trailer from shipper crushing boxes and causing leak from inner bottles DescribePack: Leak from threaded cap of inner bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged packages removed from trailer, leakage contained to packaging. 4. X-2023080808 SequenceEvent: Hazmat skid toppled on pickup trailer crushing boxes and causing leak from inner bottles DescribePack: Inner bottles leaking from threaded caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged packages removed from work area for processing. 5. X-2023080809 SequenceEvent: Hazmat skid toppled on pickup trailer crushing boxes and causing leak from inner bottles. DescribePack: Leaking from threaded caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged packages removed from trailer, leakage contained to outer packaging.

item.title: Report X-2023080753
item.description:
Report X-2023080753

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager called out leaking gas in his work area. Package was located at outbounds. Upon arrival, I smelled gas. Upon observation, I observed there was leaking gas from the inside of the package. A small amount of gas leakage on the floor was covered with absorbent powder. Package was immediately taken to the HazMat cage. DescribePack: The inside of the package had gasoline inside the tank of the lawn mower. It spilled out of the gas tank onto the box and to the outside of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent powder was immediately poured on the work area floor.

item.title: Report X-2023081472
item.description:
Report X-2023081472

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: EASTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE IRREGS BELT FOR A LEAKER. THE RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE/RESPONSE SHEETS TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. THE RESPONDER THEN TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE AND ITS CONTENTS THE RESPONDER FOUND THAT THE SEAL ON THE METAL 5 GALLON BUCKET LID WAS THE MAIN POINT OF THE LEAK. THE RESPONDER STARTED THE PROCESSING.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Happened during unloading. Package was accidentally sent upstairs and was then spotted and sent down the QA chute where package ended up being upside down. QA associate called to immediately take care of package and turned it correct side up to stop leak. DescribePack: One cap was loose causing contents to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package turned right side up.

item.description:

  • City: IRWIN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 10, 2023, one (1) 15-gallon drum containing UN3264 was damaged and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the trailer interior and the pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed a neutralizing agent and absorbents to collect the product. The crew then containerized all waste material in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking . upon inspection found one 5 gallon plastic bag of pro strip heavy duty stripper punctured and leaking allowing to release 0.5 gallons from bag no partitions or absorbent was found . facility procedures for hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition DescribePack: 5 gallon plastic bag was punctured and leaking allowing .5 gallons to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

Upon opening it was noted that one of the bottles had a small puncture right below the spout. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was turned upright to stop leakage. Product was then placed into two separate drums.

item.title: Report X-2023080748
item.description:
Report X-2023080748

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: DUNCANSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Received call over radio about leaking hazmat at WA357. Put on gloves, took bin and absorbent mats with me, placed wet package in bin, used absorbent mats on leakage that escaped box, placed on cart, took to hazmat cage for inspection and processing DescribePack: Inspection revealed a small hole in the bottom of the bottle. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Put on gloves, quickly placed package in bin, used absorbent mats on leakage that escaped the box, placed on cart, took to hazmat cage for inspection and processing, ran hands under cold water for an extended period of time just in case.

item.title: Report X-2023080746
item.description:
Report X-2023080746

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged package picked up from the unload. Upon inspection, the damaged products contained an undeclared hazmat. The package was damaged out by another station and returned to sender. A SDS was obtained for the damaged product. The other four containers were not damaged. The damaged product had a loose cap and leakage amounting to 1.057X4 Gallons. The damaged undeclared hazmat was placed in a hazmat bag and red bin. Proper paperwork was filed and that hazmat was brought to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: There was a loose cap and leakage from Detail King Bug Off. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged undeclared hazmat was placed in a hazmat bag and red bin. The hazmat was then placed in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2023080682
item.description:
Report E-2023080682

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: LEHIGHTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Miller Environmental Group was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the tops of two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released due to loose bung caps. Miller Environmental Group personnel tightened the bung caps and wiped down the two (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The two (2) 55-gallon poly drums were then shipped onto the consignee. The spent rags used from the clean-up were containerized into one 55-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080643
item.description:
Report E-2023080643

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While moving freight on temporary dock storage location, forklift operator struck a drum with the forkblade of their forklift consequently puncturing the drum and contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.

item.title: Report E-2023080558
item.description:
Report E-2023080558

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC unit was in transit and loaded with resin solution. A clean-out cap on the trailer was not secured properly and allowed approximately 5 gallons of resin solution to be released. The customer send personnel to remediate the spill.

item.title: Report E-2023080508
item.description:
Report E-2023080508

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: CORAOPOLIS
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipper initially had spilled some product on the outside of the trailer. The loading driver had them clean it up but later admitted that it could have been cleaned better. Second leak was spotted coming from the dome lid by the next driver. The driver tightened the dog ear with the security seal on it 2 turns but it was still leaking. We got permission to break the seal and tighten it properly and then had the takwash clean off the exterior before proceeding.
